intro: Notopleura tubulistipula, commonly known as the slender-stipitate notopleura, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Myrtaceae. It is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Notopleura tubulistipula is native to Australia and thrives in moist, acidic soils in woodland habitats. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphological features.
